content: Someone with the necessary knowledge (stdarch) may want to take a look at this build failure. I believe the #[rustc_const_stable] attribute is superfluous given that the item is private. If this is the case, it should be removed as it's failing a new lint.
@Jacob Pratt you'll need to make a separate PR to stdarch fixing the warning, then wait for the submodule to be updated before adding your new lint
That's what I thought unfortunately. Do you know if that attribute is in fact superfluous? I know that's not really your area.
I don't have time to look at it now, sorry. @Amanieu might know
@Jacob Pratt you can also likely allow the lint on the mod stdarch (or just arch, I forget name) temporarily
@Jacob Pratt The v128 method that is causing this error is internal and not exposed in the public API. However it is called by some const fn that are public.
I assumed that rustc_const_stable was implied on internal APIs. I take it that's not the case? If so I can only lint public methods, no?
